intro: Peucedanum neapolitanum, commonly known as the Naples cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Peucedanum neapolitanum is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
